author: mini_mads1980
title: Good Figure - With Some Extra Pieces
review:
Overview

Duke Detain is the cover character for Issue 33 of the Lego City Comic, which was available between 11th November and 08th December 2020.  This was his first appearance in the comic and he comes with a small sub build and a couple of accessories.

The price was £4.99 in the UK, which is standard when you get a free second set.  Mine was 952002 the Fireman and Drone set from Issue 24 for which I gave two stars in my review.

Packet

The foil packet has a great image of Duke on the front jumping over the roadblock, which is the sub-build for this set.  He is also holding the two accessories that you get - the handcuffs and signal.  In the top corner is an inset image of Duke Detain too.

The recommended age of 5+ seems high as it is a very simple build and a Minifigure.  On the rear of the packet is the 1:1 image of the handcuffs.

Minifigure

I believe that Duke Detain is one of the main characters in the Lego City cartoon so considering we have a had a few characters from the show appear attached to the comics already it seems that he is overdue an appearance, so it's great that we have him now.  The only shame here is that he is identical to the version that appears in these five other sets.  There are other versions of Duke that have different torsos, but this is probably the best choice for him.

The black hair element looks great on him, but probably best with the sunglasses side of his head.  The packet does not show you, but his head is printed on both sides - one side has sunglasses and an open mouth grin, and the other side shows a smile with huge eyebrows and bright eyes.

Duke Detain is made from the following parts:

  • Hair - Black Mini Wig No. 200 [6213798]
  • Head - Bright Yellow Mini Head No. 2970 [6271407] - Printed both sides
  • Torso - Earth Blue Mini Upper Part No. 4816 [6271410] - Printed both sides
  • Legs - Black Mini Body Lower Part [9339]

For a traffic cop the accessories seem correct, although the handcuffs seem like a bit too much as there is no one for Duke to Detain.  The torso and head are unique to Duke Detain, but the other elements are slightly more common - the legs very common.

Main Build / Parts

Upon seeing the small build, my seven-year-old son said "what is that?!".  It feels very much like the designer put their hand in a bag and blindly grabbed a few parts and stuck them together.  The result is what we have here.

It's nice to have a printed piece and the 2X6 Roof Tile [6230281] is quite rare, but it's not enough to save the set.

Verdict

This is basically a CMF with a few extra parts, so the value is pretty good.  As the Minifigure is the same as six other sets I don't think it's worth tracking down if you missed out on this.  Hopefully the diver in the next issue will be an improvement to this set.
